That's due to how JUnit 4 works: It uses the childless `IgnoredClassRunner` when a test class is annotated with `@Ignore`, i.e. the following code using the JUnit 4 API returns an empty list:

```java
Request.aClass(VintageTest.class).getRunner().getDescription().getChildren()
```

What's your use case?

Thanks for the reply. I expected my JUnit 4 tests with JUnit 4 runner and `Vintage` produce same results, but now they're different. Is there any way to retrieve ignored methods in ignored class via `Vintage`?
Running `VintageTest` with JUnit 4 does produce the same result, doesn't it?
Yes. Thanks for the answer, this doesn't look like a bug.
It's not a bug but I think we can improve it in the Vintage engine so it's more consistent. Thus, I'm reopening this issue. ðŸ™‚

issue.title: Support for JUnit 5
issue.body:
## Context

We're going to provide JUnit 5 support.

### What's new test framework's name?

Currently, it's named as `useJUnitPlatform()` in contrast to exsited `useJUnit()`/`useTestNG()`, but that's not decided yet, see [discussion here](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/pull/3886/files#r160560929).

### Goal

As a first step, we want to provide equivalent support as current test features for the following basic JUnit 5 features:

- Allow user to specify `useJUnitPlatform()` and run pure JUnit 5 tests.
- All our test features (e.g. `includePattern`/`excludePattern`) should work for JUnit 5 basic tests:
  - [Standard Tests](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#writing-tests-standard)
  - [Assertions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#writing-tests-assertions)
  - [Assumptions](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#writing-tests-assumptions)
  - [Disabling Tests](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/user-guide/#writing-tests-disabling)

### Existed Gradle test infrastructure

Previously, we have two [TestFramework](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/c532913159d4098e8d48f9ddce494beb9cec37f4/subprojects/testing-jvm/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/TestFramework.java) implementations: [JUnitTestFramework](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/2f94bfed05d248447439febefb45e841b7d73793/subprojects/testing-jvm/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/junit/JUnitTestFramework.java) and [TestNGTestFramework](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/2f94bfed05d248447439febefb45e841b7d73793/subprojects/testing-jvm/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/testng/TestNGTestFramework.java). The most important responsibility of theirs is to provide [TestClassProcessor](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/f24146cc5f956a1b03a515bbee4225e6f861b6ab/subprojects/testing-base/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/TestClassProcessor.java) for test worker JVM process, and `TestClassProcessor` is the main entry of Gradle test message dispatch layer. For example, [JUnitTestClassProcessor](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/33a00cae60e114ff53cb3e9cf1eeeb8356b996f4/subprojects/testing-jvm/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/junit/JUnitTestClassProcessor.java) is an concrete implementation which registers a JUnit `RunListener` to JUnit 3/4 engine, receives notification, converts and dispatches these notifications to Gradle test infrastructure. 

```
------------------------------------------------------------
                 Test progress/report
------------------------------------------------------------
            Gradle test message dispatch/collection
-------------â†‘--------------  --------------â†‘--------------
  JUnitTestClassProcessor      TestNGTestClassProcessor
     JUnit 3/4 Engine                 TestNG Engine
```

### First-step implementation

The simplest approach is to create an adapter layer and plug it into the current infrastructure. This PR slightly refactors [JUnitTestEventAdapter](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/33a00cae60e114ff53cb3e9cf1eeeb8356b996f4/subprojects/testing-jvm/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/junit/JUnitTestEventAdapter.java) and extends it as [JUnitPlatformTestExecutionListener](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/33a00cae60e114ff53cb3e9cf1eeeb8356b996f4/subprojects/testing-junit-platform/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/junitplatform/JUnitPlatformTestExecutionListener.java). `JUnitPlatformTestExecutionListener.java` implements [JUnit5 TestExecutionListener](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/current/api/org/junit/platform/launcher/TestExecutionListener.html) and adapts the received message to Gradle test infrastructure. Likewise, [JUnitPlatformTestClassProcessor](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/33a00cae60e114ff53cb3e9cf1eeeb8356b996f4/subprojects/testing-junit-platform/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/junitplatform/JUnitPlatformTestClassProcessor.java) extends [JUnitTestClassProcessor](https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/33a00cae60e114ff53cb3e9cf1eeeb8356b996f4/subprojects/testing-jvm/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/junit/JUnitTestClassProcessor.java) to avoid lots of rework.

```
----------------------------------------------------------------------
                      Test progress/report
----------------------------------------------------------------------
                    Gradle test message dispatch/collection
---------------â†‘-------------------  --------------â†‘--------------
  JUnitTestClassProcessor               TestNGTestClassProcessor
  JUnit 3/4 Engine   â†‘                  TestNG Engine
---------------------â†‘-----------
  JUnitPlatformTestClassProcessor
  JUnit 5 Engine
```

### Java 8 subprojects

All JUnit 5 jar are Java 8 format. This PR creates a new subprojects and set its `sourceCompatibility` to `1.8`. We have to instantiate `JUnitPlatformTestClassProcessor` via reflection: https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/33a00cae60e114ff53cb3e9cf1eeeb8356b996f4/subprojects/testing-jvm/src/main/java/org/gradle/api/internal/tasks/testing/junitplatform/JUnitPlatformTestFramework.java#L80 because its class format is also Java 8, which can't be used by other subprojects at compile time.

### Test integration of Gradle&JUnit 5

To avoid rewriting hundreds of JUnit 5 test cases, this PR can convert existed JUnit 4 test cases to JUnit 5 test cases:

- `org.junit.Test` -> org.junit.jupiter.api.Test
- `org.junit.Before` -> `org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach`
- ...

And then run tests with `JUnitBasicMultiVersionIntegrationSpec`.

All basic JUnit 4 tests (without `Runner`/`Categories`) in `testing-jvm` subprojects have been annotated and tested.
